title: Keystone Technologies Publishes Guide to Remote Health Monitoring
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/21/2015 @ 3:00 AM   Keystone Technologies 
ST. LOUIS, MO--(Marketwired - October 21, 2015) - Keystone Technologies, an innovator in senior care technology solutions, today announced it is publishing a guide to remote health monitoring options available for senior communities. The e-book, Choosing Remote Health Monitoring Technology: What Every Senior Living Organization Must Know , is available for free download at http://www.keystone-technologies.com/choosing-remote-health-monitoring-technology-guide . 
Maximizing the safety of residents who are alone in their apartments and rooms is among the core responsibilities of senior living providers. However, balancing safety and supervision with privacy and independence is an ongoing challenge. Providers realize that technology must play a role in monitoring patient and resident wellness. Keystone's new e-book helps senior living community leaders understand the remote monitoring solutions available for their facilities. 
The guide details four common monitoring solutions available to providers: Nurse call systems Wearable alert systems Passive remote monitoring systems 
The e-book also offers a checklist of questions to ask when choosing a solution, and explores how passive remote monitoring systems are positively impacting patient safety and senior care operations. 
"For decades, senior care providers have struggled with the question of how to address blind spots in older resident safety systems that could result in delayed care after a negative health event or other emergency," says Andy Belval, President and CEO of Keystone Technologies. "The consequences of delayed care after a negative health event can be severe not only for the resident, but also for providers, which may face fines, lawsuits, and diminished reputation after such occurrences. Our new e-book details the solutions available for providers looking to change or upgrade their systems." 
For more information about this new e-book or Keystone Technologies' innovative senior care solutions, visit the company's website at http://www.keystone-technologies.com . 
About Keystone Technologies 
Keystone Technologies provides solutions to help senior care communities offer the highest quality of life and care to their residents. The company's Keystone Care solution offers sensor-based health monitoring and artificial intelligence technology installed in seniors' living spaces that alerts care providers to warning signs of many negative health events. Keystone Connect delivers a user-friendly software portal that acts as a home base for all residents' communication, engagement, and entertainment needs. Keystone Core is a comprehensive IT infrastructure service to ensure senior care communities' applications function efficiently and effectively. Based in St. Louis, Keystone Technologies is dedicated to improving the life of all seniors -- one life at a time. For more information, visit http://www.keystone-technologies.com . Contact:
